page.title: 09OLD PEOPLE IN HERNE BAY
page.content: Of the profusion of homes for the elderly in Herne Bay some are classed as nursing homes with qualified nurses on the staff and these homes admit people with medical problems. Nursing homes cost up to Â£280 a week while the regular old people's homes varied between Â£100 and Â£170 per week. When people's money had been used up the State would continue to pay the bills. Some homes usually had vacancies but for the ones with a good reputation there would usually be a waiting list. If old people were capable they would be free to go round the town during the day and if confined to the home they might watch T.V., knit, play cards or read. The age range of these people would usually be from 70 to 100 years. Facilities offered in these homes included lifts, hoists and mini buses.
